name: Starbase
tagline: A science fiction roleplaying game mapping application
body:
### Welcome to StarBase.
Starbase is a desktop application for generating and editing maps of regions of space for science fiction roleplaying games. StarBase is developed in the Python programming language, and is open source software released under the GPL version 2 license.

### Documentation
The StarBase documentation is available in pdf format. It covers basic work flows such as creating a custom campaign map, generating random worlds, assignign allegiances, creating links on the map, producing statistical reports, map graphics, customising world descriptions and outputting world data as PDF forms. There are also sections on customising world generation using Python plugin scripts.

[Introduction to StarBase](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/1182463/StarBase/StarBase%20Introduction%200.2.21.pdf)

### Running StarBase on Windows
A pre-built Windows executable version is available from this link:

[Starbase for Windows ](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/1182463/StarBase/StarBase21_windows.zip)

### Running StarBase from source
Every referee has different requirements to suit their personal campaign and rules prefferences. That's why StarBase is open source. You're welcome to fork StarBase and customise it for your own purposes. You will need a copy of the Python programming language and several third party modules for Python. These are:

[Python 2.7](http://www.python.org/getit/)  
[Pywin32](http://sourceforge.net/projects/pywin32/)  
[PySide-1.1](http://qt-project.org/wiki/Get-PySide) -  Qt GUI framework bindings for Python  
[NetworkX](http://networkx.github.io/download.html) â€“ a network graph library

Optionally, if you wish to build the application as a Windows executable yourself, you will also need:

[Py2exe](http://www.py2exe.org/)  

### Authors and Contributors
Starbase was written and is copyrighted (2013) by @simon-hibbs.
